Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis scored off an offensive rebound with 0.7 seconds left, and the Sacramento Kings rallied from 15 points down to beat the Miami Heat 111-110 on Monday night.
DeRozan got a four-point play that started a game-ending 8-2 Kings run.
Pre-Game Insights: Kevin Huerter was out due to illness, and Keon Ellis started in his place for the Kings.
Kevin Love was back on the bench after being away for the first five games while dealing with a personal matter, but did not play for the Heat.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. was also out for the Heat due to gastroenteritis.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sacramento Kings improved to 6-31 all-time at Miami.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat led by 15 early in the third but were outscored 37-17 in that quarter.
They've been outscored 137-71 in four third quarters at home this season, and have been outscored by 20 or more points in third quarters eight times in 1,119 games at their current home arena.
Others: The Kings will host Toronto on Wednesday, while the Heat opens a six-game road trip in Phoenix on Wednesday.
